intro: Elatostema trichocarpum, commonly known as the velvetleaf stellaria, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are often covered in fine pubescence, giving the plant a velvety texture. Elatostema trichocarpum is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
